children.value: "Fight me now. If I lose I'll be your student"

. The scene where IpMan got challenged and after the challenger lose he asks to be master Ip’s disciple. Of course, there are other ways to ask someone to teach you other then challenging them. Lucky you can get out without hard beating.

I’ve always liked martial arts. First martial arts I learned was some form of MMA from my local city. I also like good martial arts movies like IpMan, The Raid, Drunken Master, etc. One thing I observed from martial arts is it’s form. Usually, when you practice martial arts there are forms to practice. You practice the form again and again and again. The main objective is to apply the form in real situation. So that, you can draw the form from your muscle memory.

As a practicioner (WAS. I want to emphasize that I’m out of shape. So please don’t challenge me or beat me up in an alley to take my lunch money), I noticed that detail of the form from one school to another are different. Even if it’s the same style under the same master. This is interesting.

From that I can draw conclusion that the way martial artist learn is to strictly absorb the style from the teacher. This strict absorbing is because usually modifying when you are under someone is considered to be disrespectful. But after that, the students adapt the style to them. Making it their own. Even adding or modifying the style in order to perfect it for them.

This process of learing can be adapted to the modern world. And I think many people follow this process already. People look for a mentor. Maybe starts with blindly follow the mentor advices. Then, start to go deep. Try to understand why he does certain things. Later absorb the technique/thought process/framework and add some spices of personality and integrate it with the rest of existing knowledge.

The advantage of following this process is to have complete understanding or context of why certain thing is the way it is. Another advantage is you can: not only learn the technique you want to learn, but also the thought process behind them.

There are also improvements we can make from the martial artist way. Martial artist tends to learn under one master for a long time. One reason could be, because the knowledge is exclusive. It’s only available in the head of the master. Using written media with 0 distribution cost (read: Internet), the process can be fasten.
